user_review: While visiting Montreal over the long weekend, my girlfriend and I had to try the smoked meat poutine here. I can't even get over how deliciously mouth watering this poutine was!!! The serving was massive! We read a review from someone saying how disappointed they were that the servings are smaller since Covid - what is wrong with you?! No one should be eating a poutine this size by themselves! We didn't even think we could finish it...but we did  It was THAT good!!! A must try when in Montreal.

We couldn't believe how busy it is. The door doesn't stop. As soon as a table left it was filled again. We both ordered Montreal smoked meat sandwiches. They were delicious. Fries were great. Comes with a pickle. They offer mayo with the fries which I loved. I even liked the coleslaw. (My boyfriend did not). The service was friendly but on the slower side. We would definitely return next time we are in Montreal. Everything they brought out from the kitchen looked amazing. We took our leftovers home with us, but we found out later the container leaked and it got all over my boyfriends new jeans.

Needed to obviously indulge in Poutine while in Montreal and Dunn's was an easy option close to the hotel that was open for 24 hours. The service was a tad stiff, but being that the place is open 24/7, I don't blame if the guy was tired.Had the french onion soup and the Montreal smoked meat poutine. Loved the french onion - it was delicious with the melted cheese and bread and a tasty broth. The poutine was great too. Crispy fries, delicious gravy and tasty smoked meat. All in all - a solid option for poutine in Montreal. It's just fries with gravy, after all.

Delicious, flavourful poutine! The best I've e ever had! The service was great! It was around two pm in the afternoon on a Tuesday, we just arrived in Montreal and were craving poutine... we wanted to go to the best place and we definitely found it! We're planning on going again at least one more time... so many more poutine flavours to try out!

Stopped by here with a party of five to soak up some excess booze. Open 24 hours, this place was surprisingly quiet for a Friday late night, as we were easily able to get a booth.Wasn't looking for anything large, settling on the plate of Chicken Wings (8 for $9). Wings are fried well though not slathered with any sauce; instead you choose one to the side (decided on the sweet & spicy). Okay flavor overall, and the side of carrots/lettuce are nominal. Looking around, probably would have been better to get a poutine instead,Service is quick and the place is kept together well despite being an overnight establishment.

Summary: If you're a tourist and looking to try poutine and smoked meat of Montreal, Dunn's is a great place to start! Prices are a little high as it is pretty touristy but food is yummy! Would recommend to give it a try if you're visiting Montreal for the first time like me.My husband and I both ordered the Small smoked meat combo (6 oz smoked meat sandwich, side of fries, coleslaw, and a half pickle) for $16.50 CAD. We both replaced the fries for poutine for an extra $4 CAD. Their smoked meat is well seasoned, but not as good as its competitors. The side order of poutine was pretty big and it was pretty good, although this was my first time trying poutine so I don't have much to compare it to.Like I mentioned in my summary, I would recommend Dunn's to tourists coming through Montreal and wanting to try the infamous smoked meat sandwich and poutine for the first time, but there may be better places for both.The wait staff was great and attentive. We visited on a Friday night around 5pm, beating the dinner rush.

Thank you fellow YELPERS for introducing us to Dunn's Famous!We arrived in Montreal after quite a delayed flight and were ravenously hungry lol and the fact that DF was open 24/7 made our decision so much easier.We walked over from our Hotel and were seated immediately and being that late it wasn't too crowded.Our server was warm and welcoming and made us feel comfortable from the get go.  I came for their famous Poutine but on seeing the Chicken and Gravy Platter with the fries I was made in the shade lolThe Wifey had the Pastrami Sandwich which she devoured and Dust had the Montreal smoked meat sandwich and Kev had the Dunn's Poutine and they loved their meals!I just wish we had more time in Montreal to come back here but we most definitely will when we're visiting again!

Checked this place while I was in the area and I love smoked meat but I much prefer Reubens. Came here in the afternoon, most of the restaurant was empty. Ordered the mini smoked meat sandwich with fries and requested no mustard on the sandwich. But guess what? Yes that's correct, the sandwich arrived with mustard. It wasn't even busy but somehow the chef still made an error. I couldn't even locate a server so I just ate it to correct the mistake and left disappointed. Oh and the smoked meat tasted more on the dry side as well so it wasn't that appealing. Left such a bad impression here. I wouldn't recommend especially with so many options for smoked meat in Montreal. Even if the restaurant is not busy, I think the servers still should be attentive to the customers that do decide to dine here. Sorry but I would not return.

The fries were good. The meat was good but compared to Katz Deli in NYC, it was okie.It was a lot of food so I was able to split it.It was our first meal there. Be sure to get the extra fat if you want it more meaty.
My husband had a original sandwich and I had a club. It was very big portion. He liked the smoke meat but I was ok with that. Smoke meat smell something chemical to me.

If you are in Montreal and didn't order smoked meat were you really in Montreal at all??Dunn's was not on our radar for list of restaurants to go to. We walked by on our way over for dinner at another place and saw the big red sign that said OPEN 24H outside of Dunn's. After another late night of shenanigans we quickly thought of Dunn's which was not disappointing at all. I ordered their Reuben sandwich served with sauerkraut and thousand island dressing,  fries, coleslaw and a pickle spear. The meat was fatty enough that it melts in your mouth but not greasy that would make you sick. The portion was big I think big enough to share with someone if you aren't overly hungry.They are a bar style so the servers are a little more laid back easy and friendly to talk to. They are very attentive and will come around filling our glasses up with ice water.Another solid place for a late night munchie run if you're in the downtown area.

Dunn's initially wasn't in my plans. I have a list of restaurants that I want to try but most of the Montreal restaurants were outside of downtown, and I was needing something close to the Bell Centre. I was also craving poutine and after doing a quick search, Dunn's looked promising. It was really packed and I was fortunate to find a seat at the bar. I already knew what I came for but I quickly scanned the menu, just in case I saw something else that was appealing. I ordered their Dunn's Famous poutine. Being in Montreal, why wouldn't you get poutine with smoked meat? You'd be crazy not to honestly. Poutine is already good as it is. And Dunn's version is no exception. The fries were very tasty and perfectly cooked. Not too soggy or too crispy. Topped with a very delicious gravy and tasty cheese curds. But this version topped with smoked meat just went over the top. It was a huge portion you could probably get away with sharing it. But I was by myself so luckily for me I didn't have to share, but had the challenge of finishing it. If I'm ever back in town, I wouldn't hesitate returning. Their service was great. Prompt and extremely friendly.

I never liked corned beef before putting this sandwich in my mouth but now I've seen the light and another way I will gain weight. Wow this shit was so good. Super tender and flavorful. It would fall off the bone if it came with a bone. And the poutine is great too. Just really good quality canadian poutine. The desserts were yummy although our tummies were busting already. We got the molten chocolate cake and carrot cheesecake. Gotta say the carrot cheesecake was my favorite no raisins

Dunn's Famous is one of the few places in town that are open 24/7. I've never been! They're located next door to Dominion Square Tavern and have two other locations in town. We dropped in on a Monday (around 2:30am) and it was surprisingly busy. Our waitress was friendly and helpful for our massive group of 12. The menu is huge but I only had eyes on their smoked meat options. It's a given that you should try their speciality.- Le petit combo ($14.50) - small sandwich served on rye bread with fresh cut fries, coleslaw and dill. Small is an understatement; this is a filling meal. The sandwich was hefty with generous slices of smoked meat. Tender, fatty goodness; perfect after a late night out. The coleslaw was refreshing but the dill pickle was bad. The fries were okay but needed more time in the deep fryer. - Smoked meat fried rice ($14.00) - a fusion dish. There was smoked meat, bell peppers, mushrooms, broccoli and onions topped with diced tomatoes and shallots. Turns smoked meat was diced too finely but the tomatoes were refreshing to the palate. Decent.Solid late night downtown spot to grab food. Stick with the smoked meat sandwiches. 3.5 stars.

Great late night spot to go to! Hubby & I came here at 10pm. Luckily it was walking distance from our hotel (Hotel Bonevature), took us less than 10 minutes to get here.Once inside, we got seated fairly quickly. I also think it wasn't too busy since we came on a weekday night (Wednesday). The booths have cute little individual coat hangers you can use too!I ordered the French Onion Soup & Sausage Poutine. Hubby ordered the Smoked Meat Sandwich & Richard's Red Ale. The server was super nice & had asked if I want the soup to come out first, or to have all the food come out at the same time. I told him we wanted it all at on once. So all our food came out pretty quick, about 15 minutes or so. My favorite hands down was the French Onion Soup!! The cheese melted was on point & I absolutely loved the broth. I practically picked up the bowl to drink it, lol. The Poutine was good too, but personally I like the regular Poutine more (just cheese & gravy). My hubby really liked the Smoked Meat sandwich and his beer. He said the meat's texture was perfect and taste was awesome. It also comes with coleslaw & pickles & fries, yum! The servings are pretty big by the way, so we ended taking some of our food to go.Overall, great spot & would def return again! Good food, good staff , & good location.
Usually, not  a big fan of poutine ... but the one we had in Dunn's was really tasty! Warm welcome and great service! Merci et vive Montréal!

Stopped by on a recent trip to Montreal when I was craving a meal of smoked Montreal meat with a black cherry Coke. I ordered a small combo and upgraded my fries for poutine which cost an additional $4. The small combo is a sandwich with white bread and smoked meat, with side of coleslaw, pickle. Both the smoked meat and poutine were served steaming hot. I could only finish maybe a third of the poutine but managed to finish everything else! I was given 2 choices for the black cherry Coke, either can of Cott or on tap. The food is standard as Dunn's has now become a chain at multiple locations including Toronto.I arrived around 6:30pm and throughout the evening there were a steady stream of customers. I only saw about 3 servers but they were attentive and did not have to wait long after placing my order.

Had the Dunns Famous (the one with smoked meat). The server was very attentive and the smoked meat complimented the poutine pretty well. My friend and I inhaled it. Wouldn't say it was the best, but it was pretty good!And the server was attentive, efficient, and very personable. He might have been a manager because the other servers were asking him things.The thing that brought it down to a 4 star was because my friend ordered the classic (Quebecois), and they weren't that many cheese curds.

Great place for delicious food! I visited for 1 night from Toronto and chose the hotel down the street in order to visit this place. Arrived extremely late... at 3am.. and luckily Dunn's famous was a 3 min walk and open. I eat Montreal smoked beef ALL THE TIME and was extremely excited to try it IN Montreal! I tried the Dunn's famous smoked meat sandwich (asked without mustard but they put it in anyway... so that wasn't good.!). The smoked meat was UNBELIEVABLY DELICIOUS! So juicy, tender, hot and nicely marinated. With it i ordered the Dunn's famous poutine . It was a huge Poutine with the perfect cheese curds and the same delicious smoked meat on top. Yumm!! I also got a spicy crispy chicken burger ... very flavorful! And i got an extra crispy chicken patty and extra of their spicy mayo.I loved it!

If you're looking for something to eat late at night this is the place to go. Especially for drunk food, a lot of fried food- it was okay but I don't recommend it in the day. I also thought that it was a tad over priced for what it was but I guess for the area it's normal. Overall it wasn't great but it was better than starving.

I've been trying the smoke meat restaurants downtown near where I work and I've been to Dunn's a few times but never wrote a review (since this was before I joined Yelp). I decided to stop by here recently during lunch.Closest metro to this place is Peel and the restaurant is located between Ste-Catherine and Rene Levesques area.When I went there, there was a terrasse in the front but I decided to sit inside. I went inside and was asked if I wanted to sit at the bar or at a table/booth. I decided to sit at the bar.I was given the menu and looked at the lunch specials. I was surprised that their lunch specials did not include any smoke meat sandwich plates. I decided to order a smoke meat sandwich (which came with the usual dill pickle, coleslaw, and fries) and just have water. I was asked whether I wanted lean or medium and I opted for medium. In the first place that I sat down in the bar which was directly in front of the draft beer dispenser, there seemed to be a lot of flies so I asked the server if I could change seats and she mentioned that it was fine so I decided to move to a few seats away.Within a few minutes, someone came with my order. The coleslaw was very good. The fries were very good as well. The smoke meat wasn't the type of smoke meat that I preferred since I like it to be a bit drier and "flakier" but it was good nevertheless.The place got very crowded very fast during my lunch. When I showed up at around 11:55am, the place was crowded (but not 100% full) and I was seated immediately. By the time I was about to leave (~12:35pm), there was a line of people waiting to be seated.I would rank the experience/food 3 stars. Service wise, I didn't get my water refilled during my meal and what type of deli or smoke meat place doesn't have a smoke meat sandwich in their lunch menu prices but has other things like fish & chips?!?! Most people going to a place like Dunn's Famous would be going for the smoke meat and not fish & chips or the other stuff shown on their lunch menu

We were here really late night with hunger and we all feel satisfied after this meal. The location is good and close to train station. The French onion soup was surprisingly great. There were lots of veggies and Bacon adding in the poutines which we liked very much. The smoked meat taste decent and not too salty compared to smoked meat I had in other restaurant.

Great find after a long day of touring the city. The Poutine was amazing!! I had the Mexican.  Yummy. The staff is friendly, it's good for kids.I would highly recommend this place.  They also have hot dogs, pizzas, fish and chips and sandwiches.  They have a few different types of Poutines such as the Dunn's famous which has smoke meat.  My husband really enjoyed it. The Molson beer  was delicious.  Cheers!!

I'm glad there's a restaurant that a family with kids can eat at that closes late in the heart of downtown Montreal. Although a little pricey like all other restaurants in downtown, they compensate their price with huge servings which can be shared with 2 people.  They are part of a chain, where you can find other dunns restaurants in other areas.Salad - 3 1/2 stars - basic, but a whole big bowl full to be eaten as a meal or shared as a side salad.Smoked meat poutine - 3 1/2 stars - super huge serving of poutine, but was a bit too salty.Margarita - 4 stars - they make it sweet in Canada with a strong coconut flavor.Service - 4 stars - although only one waitress, food came decent time.Easy to find because we could see  their huge vertical red lit sign from a block away, but because it's in the heart of Montreal, only street or paid parking lot around the area.  Since we were staying at a hotel a block away, I'm glad they were open since most of the eating places in the area that open late were only bars.

So. Much. Food!! I can't go to Montreal and NOT have smoked meat and poutine! We were here for the Grand Prix last weekend and had to stop in to Dunn's once again for our fill of deliciousness. We were seated immediately and the service was quick and efficient. I ordered the large smoked meat sandwich and upgraded to poutine. My husband got the Ruben and also upgraded to the poutine. Everything was so delicious and we received way more than we expected. This restaurant was recommended to me last year by a friend and it was so good we came back. It will definitely be a Grand Prix weekend staple!Love it.

There aren't very many poutine options near Old Montreal, except for maybe Montreal Pool Room.After drinks at Nhau bar, we were really craving late night eats, so we made our way to Dunn's for some smoked meat poutine.When you walk in, it's very diner-like and their menu looks like something out of Applebee's or TGIF.We really wanted La Banquiste or Poutineville, but it was way too far from our airbnb and Dunn's is famous for their smoked meat, so why not kill two birds?We got the smoked meat poutine and it came out SO FAST.The fries were fresh and crispy.. for about 1 minute. It's served in a big bowl topped with gravy and smoked meat. I think the fries would preserve more crispiness if it was served in a plate, more spread out. But who knows, I'm no poutine expert. Maybe it's supposed to be served like this.By the 5 minute mark, it was all just very soggy and not that enjoyable. But it was a huge amount of food! and the meat was not bad.I'd probably just make my way to one of the other poutine joints or Schwartz's next time.
Decent food and great service. We ordered their "le hot chicken" and "chicken club" sandwiches, both dishes were good, very generous portion too

It was 4:30 pm when we arrived, tired and hungry after our long journey from out West. The dry airline pretzels our only sustenance up to now. The sign beckoned us, like a sign from A higher power, "Dunn's Famous". I fell to my knees and wept, at long last, my precious. Montreal Smoked Meat. I spotted a sign from above "Massage". Perhaps a massage while covered with smoked meat? One could only dream of such things. It was early enough in the day that we were quickly ushered to a quiet, out of the way booth at the back. I hoped the waitress wasn't offended by my inquiry about the "meat massage". We ordered up a couple frosty pints and chugged them with reckless abandon, the memory of our meagre airplane fare still fresh in our minds. When hubby and I were married a blissful 10 years ago, he made a deal with a foodie. The deal was this, if I call "sharesies" then we are bound by matrimony to order things we could share so that no one person has to suffer by inadvertently ordering a "lesser dish". And so it was, that we ordered the Super Combo Smoked Meat and Dunn's Famous Poutine. To share.The food arrived at a breakneck speed, I barely had time to check out the vintage photographs lining the hallowed walls.The food, ahhhh, the food! Tender and buttery soft smoked meat, ordered "lean" because hubby doesn't appreciate connective tissue and fat. Alas, that's one of the colossal responsibilities of "sharesies", to take the other parties preferences into consideration. The delicately sliced meat was piled high, high, high, and nestled in between two little slices of incredibly fresh rye bread with a light smear of mustard. Nothing more was needed. A generous side of crispy fries, a saucer of fresh slaw and a slice of dill pickle. Perfection. Not one iota of pretension to be found.The poutine was perfect. Hot and tasty fries, fresh, melty cheese curds covered with gravy and topped with chopped Montreal smoked meat. Uncomplicated and flawless.Having lived my smoked meat "foodie" dreams, I believe I could die happy at this very moment. Except...we have 6 more days of culinary discoveries ahead. I was born for this moment.

From what I can see, Dunn's is a localized version of a TGIFriday's which is perfectly fine. They have several locations around Montreal and their claim to fame is smoked meats. Think New York style pastrami. Of course like a TGIFriday's, they have a ton of other menu items. This location also happens to be 24/7 - another plus. I don't especially enjoy breakfast foods, so a full menu restaurant at 8am is perfect for me. I was planning on getting Schwartz later for smoked meat (think Katz Deli) so I opted for an Uber driver recommendation of hot chicken. This isn't the Nashville version so don't confuse the two. It's essentially a shredded chicken sandwich drenched in Salisbury steak gravy and topped with peas. Be warned, not everyone will enjoy this sandwich. I personally did. It reminded me of childhood when I religiously ate microwaved HungryMan Salisbury steak TV dinners. The waitress was also very attentive. I'd come back again to try the rest of the menu.

Ok so I'm not sure what Dunn's is famous for but I pray it isn't their poutine. Pretty pedestrian at best.Ok so i had poutine for the 1st time in Portland Me 3 yrs ago and ever since then I've tried to recreate the 1st time when I venture into a place that has poutine. Sadly nothing was on the same playing field. Anywho a few months back I saw a video on  a popular Youtube  food channel where the host went on a poutine eating adventure in Montreal. Ever since then I've been pretty hyped about a work trip we had scheduled in Montreal. TBH this wasn't the top of my list of places to try but it was the closest within walking distance of my hotel with pretty good reviews so I figured what the hell... Myself and some coworkers split a couple of the poutines (classic and famous). The famous is topped with smoked meat that was ok...not really great flavor. The biggest disappointment was the cheese curds were cold and lacked the pop you get when you bite into one. The gravy was also pretty bland. Bottom Line: Go for something other than poutine. I heard from a local after going that the cheesecake is excellent so try that if you must. If you do want excellent poutine check out La Banquise...it restored the poutine Montreal hype.

Came here midnight past after arriving late into Montréal Cute retro diner look,service a bit slow for being empty ...Service adequate Pricey sloppy enormous amounts of food without much flavor french fries soggy...Reuben and club....smoked meat is beef brisket. ...for the money reuben is mainly bread ...menu has too many other weird options not related to a classic deli which was my first red flag....would not recommend..

Downtown old style cafe. Venue is dingy  on the outside but welcoming once inside. It shows its roots and is touristy. Seating is stall style. The food makes up for the age. The French fries are fresh cut and nicely cooked. The smoked meat sandwich is overfilled with meat- really good. Coleslaw appears to be made on site it's nice crunchy but a bit heavy on sugar.Pro tip. Eat the fries quickly as they will cool.Ice tea is premix with sweetener and lemon flavoring - in my case - yucky. Water or beer draft is a much better choice.

Came here late night on a Monday after attending the casino. It was about 5am and pretty much empty. For my food I got the chop chop poutine (poutine with chopped smoked meat). It was ok, personally nothing special, and smoked meat albeit chopped up small pieces just didn't have a great taste to me. Along with the poutine, I had a order of their buffalo wings. Straight to the point: chicken is bland and not good. Even though the sandwiches are the number one thing, I probably won't be back to try.

DINER HEAVEN This is the original location of Dunn's Famous that opened in 1927. It's a diner that serves a little bit of everything. Our mission was to have the smoked meats and poutine. We arrived after 1pm when the Canadians hockey game started up the street. We wanted to plan it that way, so there wouldn't be a wait for a table. I want to say that we timed it perfectly. In fact, it started getting crowded as we were waiting for our food here. The best part is that the game was on the tv and we could enjoy watching it. Our waiter was Fred and he was really nice. He was able to answer all of our questions and provided excellent service. We started out with two beers for us and a bowl of soup for the little one. I went with a Rickard's Red and my wife had a Coors light. I told her that the Coors was basically Canadian beer since Molson was brewing it up the street using Canadian water. The Coors in Canada has no Rocky Mountain Water in it. The soup was really good. Imagine a baked potato that was turned into a creamy soup and then covered with all of the baked potato toppings including cheese and bacon.  The dish is brilliant because baked potatoes come free with entrees and I'm assuming the left over potatoes become soup. I love smart chefs. I do highly recommend the warm soup on a cold day. This soup hit the spot because it was totally cold in Montreal. I also wanted to try poutine for the first time. I can not believe I've spent my culinary life avoiding this. I really didn't want to eat it in America. I think I wanted my first poutine to be an original and that's why I ordered it here. I also kept it simple by going with the gravy and cheese curds on top of the fries. I must admit that it was really good plus I had to fight my little one when eating these. I find it amazing to introduce brown gravy and curds to a child who instantly falls in love with the dish. I've got a little foodie on my hands. Our main entree was the Ruben sandwich which was huge. It comes with fries, baked potato or rice. You can always upgrade the side for a price. We went with the onion rings for an additional $3. I figured we had enough fries with the poutine. The sandwich was amazing and it was enough to feed all three of us. It was a double decker served with a pickle, Swiss cheese, thousand island sauce and coleslaw on the side. It was truly delicious. I also want to share some info about the meat. Montreal is famous for their smoked meats and the process they use really shows in the final product. A Montreal meat is brined for 14 to 20 hours and then smoked for 9 hours. Where an American corned beef is rushed with a brining as short as a few hours and then the meat being steamed for three hours. The Montreal version of corned beef will blow away your foodie senses. The meat is basically a beef brisket and when you order your sandwich you can choose one of three cuts: fatty, medium or lean. We stick to the medium because we want that flavor marbled in the meat. The Montreal smoked meat dates back to the 1890's, so it's a must have. I highly recommend you get the smoked meats in Montreal. There are several old school places serving it. We choose this place because it's been doing it the longest. I wanted to go to a classic place that's been doing it right for almost 100 years. I can't wait to come back here. This place was a great addition to our culinary tour of Montreal.

In my opinion I like Schwartz better then Dunn's however the poutine was very good here.  Ordered the mini smoked meat sandwich and upgraded fries for a poutine.  The meal also came with Cole slaw and a dill pickle.  The Poutine was big enough to share and was not able to finish my meal.

Omg the Montreal smoked meat is as good as it gets here.  The meat was moist and not overly salty, and I got the medium fat and it was perfect. Imagine if the corned beef and the pastrami had the perfect baby. It was that good.Service was good, and our drinks were refilled without asking.  The poutine was good, but the smoked meat was even better... did I mention it was amazingly good?During our stay in Montreal, we tried 4 other places who supposedly had great smoked meats.  I would come back to Dunn's in a heartbeat, and best of all... they are open 24/7

Taste: 5Service: 3Value: 4Presentation: 5Overall: 4.2 Hi and welcome to another episode of javing it with Javier. It's definitely been a while but we are starting our adventure in Montreal this time. Being I was hungry and just got into the city, I decided to stop by for a late night snack. The poutine selection was endless but I decided to get their famous poutine.The poutine came in a pretty big bowl with melted cheese and Montreal smoked meat sprinkled on top. I wish the fries were a bit crispier but this is one of those places where the cheese curds are actually melted. The flavor of the gravy was good but was slightly saltier than I expected. It was still very good though! To finish off the night, I tried their chocolate cake and strawberry cheesecake dessert. Both of them were good and I had a tough time deciding which was better.Being it was a bar, the staff were pretty laid back and I had to wave then over to take our orders. The staff were very friendly though.I shared my poutine and dessert with my girlfriend as there was no way I could finish by myself. For the amount of food they gave, 20ish bucks was a steal!In conclusion, I have other poutine places to try but they definitely make a mean poutine. Also the fact that it is open 24 hours you can sate your poutine desires at any time. And that's it for today's episode of javing it with Javier. And remember food is life!

Smoked meat poutine = the only way to kick off a trip to Montreal. Luckily our hotel was around the corner from Dunn's and we were able to make this happen as soon as we arrived.Dunn's is a casual spot - basically like a hybrid diner / deli. The menu had a variety of different types of sandwiches, poutine and grill food. Because Montreal is known for poutine and smoked meat we opted for a big bowl of poutine topped with smoked meat. This wasn't the best pastrami that I've ever had, but was still delicious and tasted great mixed with the poutine. I also ordered a crock of french onion soup which was topped with tons of cheese and had great flavor. Nothing better when the high is below zero degrees!We washed everything down with some cold Molson (okay, if you can't tell we were excited to be in Canada) and were in and out in under an hour. Overall, Dunn's is a solid pick if you want a fast hot lunch in Montreal.

Poutine!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Okay, so this wasn't the BEST I ever had but I still really enjoyed the poutine they served here.  Let's put it this way, I liked it enough that I went two days in a row.  That's also because I really liked their smoked meat sandwich platter ... which was just awesome.  The meat was good and I actually enjoyed this more than Schwartz's.  Yeah yeah call me crazy but I felt the meat here was more tender and juicy.  As someone who's lived off Jewish delis pretty much most of my life in NYC, I guess there was just something about Dunn's smoked meat that seemed to fit my palate better.The service here was decent.  It got kind of busy both nights I was here but the servers were all still attentive and checked on us to make sure things were okay.  I was too pleased with my meal on both nights honestly to notice anything else ... so you get the idea.That's not to say you shouldn't visit Schwartz's.  But if you're not near that area and you're looking for a good plate of meat and fries oozing with gravy and cheese curds and you happen to be in the downtown area ... you can't go wrong with Dunn's!

Always reliable, always delicious, always friendly and most importantly, always open. I first visited this sumptuous place, which has been around forever, 35 years ago. Yummy smells, yummy food and decent prices. It's one of my favourite places whenever I travel to Montreal. It is well worth a visit anytime.

-casual atmosphere-The poutine is a must. This was my favorite poutine in Montreal! We had the basic poutine with cheese curds and gravy, I could not stop eating it! -If you are looking for a classic montreal meal and want a smaller portion. I suggest splitting the smoked meat sandwich and upgrade your fries to poutine. This is a perfect sized lunch for two people. -the smoked meat sandwich was just as good as Schwartz's without the long wait. This is something you must eat while in Montreal. -Our server was friendly and checked up on us an appropriate amount of times. -My only negative is that the tables are a little too close together. You can easily dive into the conversation of the people sitting next to you.

Thought this was a great place for no frills Montreal / Canadian food. This place is popular enough but without the insanity of lines. We stopped by early in the afternoon on a weekend and were seated immediately. I got their reuben smoked meat sandwich and subbed out the fries for poutine (+$4), which was 100% worth it. At this point in my trip, I still haven't had any poutine. I probably should have gone with the la petite sandwich because I could only finish about 3/4 of my meal. The poutine was great and just as good as I imagined it would be. The smoked meat sandwich was good but not as good as the one I had a day earlier at another restaurant. The bread was a little too dry around the edges, so I ended up peeling off the crust. Overall, a good value and place to stop by if you want something casual and local.

Wasn't sure what to expect from this place. Seems a little gimmicky, but it was close to where i was staying and we needed a little late night food. We tried the poutine with smoked meat. I'm no poutine expert, but I really enjoyed it. We also got the latkes, which lacked good crunch, but had good flavor.I was surprised that they only had bottled soda instead of fountain. I love that it's open 24 hours.

Delightful food and service.After checking in to our hotel, we wandered to Dunn's in late afternoon. Dunn's had a definite diner feel.  We were promptly seated in a tall backed booth.  We had different items grim their menu and all were tasty.  We did have smoked meat and it was good. My husband loved The vinegar based coleslaw. The service was also great.  They also have a kids' menu which was a nice change.  You won't be disappointed.

Dunn's Famous in Montreal, QC is known for their smoked meat Sammmies, poutine, and cheesecake. Our waitress was helpful and said it was a $4 up charge to add poutine to our lunch special. We ordered the smoked meat on a sesame bagel (best sesame bagel with sesames embedded). It also came with coleslaw and a pickle. The poutine was in a bowl and big enough to split, which we did. The fries, gravy, cheese curds had a good flavor. The smoked meat Sammie was tasty too. We also shared a small cup of their homemade cream of potato soup. It was creamy but had chunks of potato. Delish!!We sat outside and will definitely return when going back to good ol' Montreal!! Maybe we will try that famous cheesecake next time!

We came for a lunch on a Sunday and it was pretty packed.  We weren't greeted promptly and the service was a little slow.  However, this was made up for by the very generous portions they provided.  We ordered the Smoked Meat Super Combo with a side of Dunn's Poutine.  This was easily enough to feed 2 adults (and certainly enough to feed 1 adult).The food was delicious and we were taken care of despite not being seated quickly upon entering the restaurant.The decor was unique as well, owing to the long history of the Dunn's Famous franchise.

This place is great in a pinch, when you want to have the famous Montreal smoked meats, but don't want to wait forever at Schwartz and are downtown. Smoked meat was great, but not the absolute best. Some of the other dishes were a bit lacking, to be honest. Still, worth trying if you want a familiar casual restaurant atmosphere, and to try classic Montreal food.

I was determined to try the local fare in a place that was consistently offering a standard over a number of years with a respectable following and Dunn;s Famous fit the bill.  The host seated us immediately and we requested a move against the wall.  We soon found out why we were not placed there immediately,  a mosquito or two (I killed the ones by our table immediately).  The server came over and she was patient, helpful and willing to bring me the order of poutine separated because I get indigestion very easily if I over do it with rich foods.  I will say it is delicious as a dip for my fries on the fork (I wish the cheese curds were not cold though). Know that the gravy is a little salty and very savory, so saaavoooryyyy!The sandwich and fries were big enough for us to split with extra bread (I added lettuce and tomato, yeah I know, but it was tasty) and some dijon Maille mustard, so good.  The texture and taste is like pastrami ad brisket had a Canadian baby, a meaty tasty baby.  We were stuffed after, but I spotted the lone biscuit/cookie in a cake plate.  I could not resist and Im glad I could not.  It was so soft and delicious!  I recommend you try and snag a few.  The other standout were the smoked meat spring rolls, I wish I got some for the road, they were amazing.The bathrooms (the mens entrance was a little crazy looking, with missing/broken tiles) were downstairs (not so good for the handicapped patrons).  Otherwise, try it out.  It has a lot of history in this city for good reason.  Good food and decent prices.

The main attraction of this place is that it's open 24 hours a day. You can find your classic burgers and fries, but also poutines and some salads.  Don't expect high end cuisine, but plenty of food and not terribly expensive. Good selection of beers, both bottled and on tap.

Is always great to come back to Montréal and find little spots like Dunn's. Open 24hr the food is delicious. I ordered the Famous Dunn's Poutine portion was big and gravy just delicious. Place has a nice decor and service was good considering there was only one server. Next time Im in town i will be coming back for more dishes

One of the staples of Montreal. The poutine is great, but I'd have to say I prefer the smoked meat at Schwartz's. Overall nice and casual atmosphere at the restaurant as well. Definitely not a bad place to check out when you're in town.

Good food, but very poor/prejudice service. (It was myself and twin brothers birthday of all days)   We came here after a long day of being out exploring all things worth while and this was a 24 hr late night place that was recommended.   We were seated shortly after entering and provided menus by who we now know was the bus boy. There was a short bald headed Asian guy sitting at the booth closest to the kitchen who looked like he worked there, but just stared at us. We sat there for about 10 minutes before I had to get up and ask if we could please have some water. The bus boy brought us water and we sat almost another 10 minutes when a couple walked in, the bald Asian guy got up, seated them, gave them a menu, took their drink order and a short while later brought their drinks and took their order. (I'm speechless and trying not to be bothered by it)   I asked the Caucasian guy who seated us if it would be possible to order to which he replied "I'm not your waiter" (he wasn't rude, but it threw us off because no one else came by at all). The couples food came out, the bald Asian guy took it to them and then came over, did not greet us, but he took our order. I was hungry but did not order as I refuse to spend money when I'm not being treated fairly which appeared to be a prejudice on the Asian guys part (I want to be clear on the nationality so readers are aware who this is I'm speaking of as it was one individual.)   The bus boy brought our food out, and no one ever came back to the table. The bald Asian guy continued to stare as though he had a problem. I had to get up and get napkins for the table, and when we were ready to go and still no one checked on us, our gal pal had enough. She called for service, a togo box and the bill. The bald Asian guy comes to the table and my friend asks who our waiter is to which he replies "Me", she told him we wouldn't know because we haven't received service and with the exception of taking our order he hasn't been back once. He never apologized and gave us the bill.    I paid the bill, left no tip and we walked out. Some may know what it feels like being mistreated based on prejudice, but I'm aware some have the privledge of not having experienced it. Its an awful feeling when you've done nothing at all and are spending money.   I can't in good conscious recommend this place to anyone...it was very disrespectful and without cause. The one star is for the food/bus boy. I took no pictures as I will not promote them.

This place can be good depending on the chef. I first tried this place 3 years ago and thought the smoke meat was better than Schwartz. It was very moist and tasty. Even the poutine was excellent. Therefore, we came back here 3 years later because we were craving a good Montreal smoke meat sandwich. This time I would say it is below par. The meat was dry and the poutine was just ok. We might give this place another shot because it is still better than restaurant in Toronto. However, we would probably try other places first before coming back.

We weren't leaving Montréal without trying the Poutine Fries. We decided to go with Dunn's Famous ... wish they would give you nice slices of meat as opposed to what appears to be leftover crumbs from the carving table. I did order the gravy on the side which kept the fries nice and crisp til the end. I thought the smoked meat was moist and flavorful, better than Schwartz.

The conspiracy theorist in me is starting to think everyone gets their smoked meat from the same place. Do the French just sous vide everything?  Montreal pastrami has replaced NYC as being the best, in my book. This is going to cause problems in my marriage to a New Yorker. I'm still with him on bagels though so I think we're good. This is my third restaurant and they've all been tender and delicious. I ordered a petit combo which was half a smoked meat sandwich, coleslaw and fries. Your typical platter. Zero complaints.  I do love the Montreal style of coleslaw (no mayo like its American counterpart).I've yet to try Schwartz. Felt like I should gear up to them so I know what I'm talking about when I go visit the king of smoked meats. Have to say, it's not boding well for them as it seems you can get a really good sandwich just about anywhere.
Great spot for Montreal smoked meat. I had a great sandwich and poutine! Has been a while since my last time in Quebec and I was missing it. This didn't disappoint
I'll give it an extra star since prices have gone up elsewhere.I just tried their breakfast, tasty eggs and decent sized for 7 bucks is pretty good around these parts.

I don't know how this place has been open so long.They have the worst staff I've ever seen. They all stand around playing on their phones they are dressed like bums and just laugh in the back instead of helping others.Worst food Ever.We asked which was better the egg rolls or the spring rolls with smoked meat. Litteraly puke worthy. Taste like Pee and dog hair I couldn't Believe they served that to people.Burger was disgusting it was pretty much raw and no flavour. The bun was old.No sauce just simply disgusting.I can't believe I went back here twice in once week if I could give them a 0 star I would.One woman in the resto asked for the manager to ask why their was no chicken in her hot chicken and everyone turned around the manager just added some more same plate it's disgusting behaviour I will never return and be sure to let everyone know.

What a cute little place to go to and enjoy the smoked meat sandwich. It's huge and so very good! Their French onion soup was the best I had ever eaten, yummy! It's reasonable and you get a lot of delicious food! The interior has lots of memorabilia that is interesting to read about and the bar is beautiful. The server I think might have been having a bad day but besides that I enjoyed myself very much!

Had lunch here 2 times this week.  Always the brisket sandwich on rye, pickle,  slaw, and fries.  As good as it gets.  They call it smoked meat.  As a new yorker, it seems very much like pastrami, or corned beef.  It has no taste of smoke, but delicious pickled spices and tender to perfection.   The potatoes are  real, not frozen and perfect.  No mayo in the slaw... which is the best way to make it. Even the deli pickle was great.   I had to return in 2 days to repeat this sandwich.   A great little place with delicious  reliable food.  A must when I  get to Montreal  from now on.....

I've been here several times. This is my 1st review. I've always been a fan of delis and diners and this one still always manages to hold up. I went for a nice bowl of Matzo ball soup and the spaghetti with smoked meat. Soup was delicious, but to be honest it was lukewarm. I'm sure they would have heated it up for me if I asked...but I didn't say anything. The pasta with smoked meat was really good. I've had it many times before and it was as good as ever. A nice hearty meal overall. And the service was great too.

Probably my fault for not trying their smoked meats but after 3 straight days of Meat & Poutine, I wanted a chicken plate for dinner. Asked the bartender if he recommended the Chicken Tender appetizer or the Buffalo Chicken Wrap with Fries. He said to try the wrap. I can not recommend Dunn's. The buffalo chicken wrap that I received was basically a lettuce wrap with poor quality wings sauce. I would not eat that dish again even if they paid me $20 to finish it. My friend had the General Tao Poutine and he said it was the worst Poutine he had during our 3 day trip in Canada. Do yourself a favor and try a different restaurant.

Another go to place that I always come for when I want some poutine with smoked meat on top. However, times have changed and they give a slightly smaller portion compared to previous years I have visited. I'd recommend their rib eye steak as well.

Can't go wrong with this place. I had their buffalo wings with ranch which were excellent and my girlfriend had their buffalo chicken poutine which she loved. It was her first time trying poutine and she was not disappointed. The place was very unique looking and a great atmosphere. Waitress spoke both French and English so was easy to converse without any issues. Would definitely eat there again if we are ever back in Montreal.
Just stopping through for the day and needed some place open late.Randomly walked by this place and decided to give it a try. Absolutely amazing! I'll definitely stop by again if I'm ever here!!

Service: 4/5Food: 4.5/5Ambiance: 3/5I visited Montreal for vacation, and heard "smoked meat" was one of THE items to try. There were a few places on my list, but I ended up here at Dunn's. I came for lunch on a Sunday afternoon, and it wasn't too crowded when I first walked in. Ten minutes later, it seemed like an entire middle school or high school took over the restaurant, so it became super loud/noisy. This is a very casual place, so I couldn't get too irked by the crowd.The smoked meat here was absolutely delicious. The meat was so tender and fell apart. I loved that there were three choices: lean, medium fat, or super fatty. I opted for the medium fat, and I was not disappointed in the slightest. I will say that I was also pleasantly surprised by the cole slaw. It wasn't doused in mayo like many places I've been to, and the flavor was refreshing/wonderful when paired with the smoked meat. Overall, I really enjoyed the food.
In line with my expectations for this quite famous place: great smoke meat sandwiches in a nice location. Generous servings and helpful service.
Poutine that I got was average at best. More like McDonald's fries with sausages and gravy, not the poutine that you get in some other places.

The service here was amazing but otherwise it was just okay. The poutine was way too salty and came out luke warm plus I think it is overpriced for what you get. The coffee was very weak but it did the job. I didn't try the smoked meat and maybe I should have as that's what they're known for. I would go back just because the service was outstanding but I wouldn't get the poutine again.

The smoked meat was very sumptuous and delicious and we had poutine with it which was an extra delight!Our waiter suggested to order medium and we did and were not disappointed. So juicy warm tender.The music was soft rock and relaxing. You could watch the soccer game on the tv.Loved it.

Loved this place. I went here with my family while we were staying in Montreal for the week. This was an inviting little restaurant with about a dozen tables and a bar. I ordered the hamburger steak and my wife ordered a poutine bowl. Our waiter explain how the poutine bowls in Quebec are the best around because of the curds. Mu wife agreed she bought the dish was delicious.I loved the hamburger steak. I usually am not a big fan of break anyway. I felt like I could eat more hamburger meat because of the lack of bread. It was great and it inspired me to recreate the dish at home.The waiters were awesome and we asked some questions about the area and they were very knowledgeable and friendly. It was a very chill atmosphere overall.

What looks like a Canadian version of Applebees is really a NYC Jewish deli mixed with classic poutine.My party and I were eager to try some Québecois local food and headed here after reading rave reviews - we weren't disappointed. The interior was strongly reminiscent of a family style American restaurant joint (think Chili's, Applebees, Ruby Tuesday, et al) with the booths, sports broadcast on the TV and dimmish lighting.Our waiter was very attentive, friendly and courteous, unsurprisingly (what else do you expect from Canada?) and came out with our food quickly. Together, we had the Thai chicken wrap, French onion, bagel with smoked meat, and smoked Club - all dishes, whose fries side was upgraded to a Dunn's style poutine (fries, gravy, cheese curds, and more smoked meat, ho yeah!). It was all incredibly heavy and dense, but delicious. The meal was perfectly smoked and surprisingly tender (and this is me, a new yorker saying this) - the soup was a bit salty for my liking, but had a great baked fromage on top. The Thai chicken wrap had barely any kick even though the waitress warned us of one, and the slaw was a good complement to the saltiness of everything else. Even though I was off put by the heaviness of the gravy poutine, I can still admit it was stellar.We ended our meal with a slice of strawberry cheese cake to share, and even though they had a layer or strawberry gelatin as a bed for the Strawberries, the cake was well balanced in decadence - not the heavy packed cream cheese block you see at a lot of places, but crumbly  as it should be, leaving a satisfaction without feeling like you're cheating.Definitely enjoyed our meal, but still worried about my arteries!

While casually strolling the streets we saw this place and thought we should come in and try the smoked meat. Why? There were pounds of smoked meat displayed in the window and I immediately turned into one of those cartoon characters. You know, the ones where they smell food and their bodies drift toward it. Yea, that was me when I saw smoked meat in the window.They have a pretty vast menu so I'm assuming there's something for everyone. My bf ordered the smoked meat sandwich and I ordered the poutine with smoked meat on top. The smoked meat sandwich was pretty good. The meat was tender and fatty and damn near melted in my mouth. The poutine was ok. I'm not sure why, but the smoked meat on the sandwich was a lot better than the smoked meat on top of the poutine. Also, I wasn't a huge fan of the gravy. It was kinda watery. I prefer gravy that's a bit thicker.The service was awful. We were greeted and given menus when we walked in but people kept walking by us until finally we had to flag someone down for waters. Then, they took our order (finally). It took forever to get the check and no one ever stopped in to see if we needed anything else. We ate, paid, and got the hell outta there. It could have been a 4 rating if the service wasn't so crappy.

Went there on my last night in Montreal because I was craving poutine. I ordered the Québécoise which is the original fries with cheese and gravy. It was very tasty. If I ever go back to Montreal I will eat here again
We had a delicious Montreal lunch here at Dunn's! The smoked meat platter was HUGE and the Dunn's poutine was incredible. Great atmosphere and great service!

I was looking for a diner to grab some food and kill some time before a show. I had low expectations, given that I was right in the middle of downtown on a Sunday night, when it seemed like I might end up at a restaurant that is more typically found in a mall.Obviously this isn't a fancy place, but it's a great spot for some delightful diner vibes and loitering. The servers were super friendly (not like diners back home!). The food was fast and pretty good. Obviously I got the smoked meat, because what else are you there for?I'm not sure if I lucked out on the quality of the people watching opportunities or if it's always this good (there's another Yelp review mentioning post-bachelor party smoked meat, so maybe this is the type of tourists this place draws in). While I was happy with the food and the overall experience, the people watching made it great.

Excellent! We asked our hotel's concierge where could we find a good smoked meat restaurant and he directed us in the right direction! So off to Dunn's Famous! We started our meal with wings (with the Buffalo sauce on the side). Now, as Americans we are wing connoisseurs, however, among wings connoisseurs your tastes may vary. Some like their wings fried very hard, some not so much. I'm on the "not so much side" which is why I gave this Restaurant overall 5 stars, but I didn't really care for the wings. My boyfriend, and most of my friends, prefer that their wings be friend hard, not me, and to me they were fried way toooo hard but the sauce did make up for it. But now on to the main event...the smoked meat. We both had the smoked meat plate which was smoked brisket on rye with mustard, and sorry, I insisted on adding Swiss cheese to my sandwich. It came with house made chips (fries) and homemade coleslaw. Yummmmm! Now the coleslaw was a bit different from what I'm used to. Everywhere I've been in Montreal, the coleslaw has been vinegar based and not mayonnaise based and I'll admit I really enjoyed it. It had a much lighter taste.Now as far as the sandwich is concerned, interesting. Now I'm from Philadelphia, PA and I grew up in Jewish Delis. Shout out to Murray's Deli and Hymie's Deli on Lancaster Avenue in Bala Cynwyd, PA. Best deli sandwiches ever. But back to my review, I thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich and it was so large that I could only eat 1/2 of the sandwich, 1/5 of my fries yet all of the coleslaw.  Delicious!! And the crazy part is that they're open some insane schedule, like 24 hours. Our server was great and she was very knowledgeable. I believe her name was Ali and she had quite a sense of humor. Yo be maybe 20 something, she ran that restaurant like it was no one's business. So if you are looking for great smoked meat, or are hungry after everything else is closed check out Dunn's. You won't be disappointed.

Dunn's was highly recommended and did not disappoint. There was a large lunch crowd but it was not an issue. We were seated immediately and the service was great. The food came out surprisingly fast and was delicious. All the other customers seemed equally satisfied. Dunn's has indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor area is covered and right on the street. Good if you want to people watch. The Underground City is a block away, only a 30 second walk.
I came here with high hopes but felt let down. I got the smoked meat poutine and it was just gross. Quite disappointing.

24/7 restaurant, literally, so it is a place we go every once in a while when we find ourselves starving at 4am and everything else is closed. Everything is good, burgers, sandwiches, poutines, smoked meats, you name it. I usually go for a smoked meat sandwich and personally add chop liver all the time. That thing is not on the menu and I can't remember how come I got to know about this extra hidden feature, but somehow I know it and I always ask to put some extra chopped liver in my sandwich, check my picture. And I always ask for a chocolate milkshake mmm yummy...
Great sandwich mid day and top notch fresh cut fries.  Enjoyed the stop here. Had the petite and it was more than enough.

Cho and I were coming close to the end of our 24hr Montreal adventure, but we had to satisfy his Korean smoked meat rampage one more time even though it was 1am. Schwartz was closing so we opted for Dunn's- open 24 hours!Both of us weren't particularly hungry as we had already eaten all day, so we decided to share the Rueben which comes with coleslaw, pickles and fries. We added smoked meat spring rolls. The total was about $25.The atmosphere was a classic 1960s diner which i loved. The place was quite packed. The service was appropriate as the waitress was busy.Tastewise everything was on point. Compared to Schwartz, the smoked meat at Dunn's is more fatty and moist which carries more flavour and with the cheese, dressing and self-applied mustard it was an explosion in the mouth. The Korean boy grinned with ecstasy. The meat at Schwartz is cooked longer, less moist but carries a bit more texture. The fries were crispy, and the coleslaw and pickles really balanced everything well.The Korean beast and I could have easily ordered another, the food was extremely satisfying. Stay tuned for the final episode of- 24 hours in Montreal with Tonka Tonka Cho.Service- 4/5Location- 5/5Atmosphere- 5/5Cleanliness- 4/5Food- 5/5Price/Value- 4/5Would i return? Yes!

Stopped here for lunch for some famous smoked meat.  I was thoroughly impressed with the amount of food, the freshness of all the products, and the ambiance. The service was not terrific, which really only deserves a 1/2 star deduction, but I'm unable to do that. I will definitely be back!

So glad we found Dunn's as we were staying at a nearby hotel and we got so tired of eating in the food court in the underground. The portions here are huge, the prices super reasonable, and this is a clear, well lighted restaurant, with comfortable tables and the food comes fast. My favorite is the hot dog platter, the dog is huge, and comes with relish and mustard. I put the coleslaw on it too, and I loved that the coleslaw was vinegar based. The fries are hand cut and so flavorful. And a shout out to our waiter. He was super fun and knew how to handle a table of "Southern girls".

Well I did it, that is I went to both Schwartz's and Dunn's and now I need to determine which was better - for me at least;)For me the meat at Schwartz's was better, not to say that Dunn's was bad- both top quality meats. I found the staff at Schwartz's more engaging with the customers - great for some, but sometimes you just want to spend some quality time with your significant others, so I'll call it a draw for staff.In terms of variety (aka non meat choices) Dunn's is king! At Schwartz's meat is your bundle!I have to give Dunn's the edge on ambience as well - Schwartz's felt rushed.Bottom line if you are looking for a relaxed great meal Dunn's the winner ( also they have alcohol!!)

Came in for a quick bite. My friends loved their food and poutines. Bartender gave a good pour. However, I didn't like the bathroom being at the bottom of the stairs and didn't like sitting in the extra chair. Felt like I was in the way the whole time.
Fanatic food with great portion sizes. Got the pulled pork poutine and it was amazing. Will definitely go back next time I am in Montreal.

Wow. Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. Me and a few friends came by here after a bachelor party, looking to get some classic Montreal smoked meat sandwiches. I've heard great things about Dunn's but this was my first time going. Even though it was a large group, we were accommodated & seated fairly quickly, and the food didn't take long to come out either. Montreal has a bunch of great places to eat & this is a classic spot you need to come by.Recommendations :REUBEN Smoked meat, swiss cheese, sauerkraut and Thousand Islands dressing. Served on pumpernickel bread with homemade fries, coleslaw and dill.The amount of meat on this sandwich was insane. Definitely a filling and something I would have again Thanks again to everyone at Dunn's for an amazing experience

Restaurant had been there since 1927.  Must be doing something right. Unpretentious,  casual dining.  Selection of beer, wine and cocktails. Smoked meat was fantastic!   Smoked meat plate was thick cut, and better than the sandwich.  Cheese cake was well deserving of reputation.   Fries were excellent, made from real potatoes,  unlike most of the fast food places.   Full of potato flavor.  Poutine was good.  Love this place.

I was in Montreal for a business trip and wanted some poutine (duh.) Dunn's was within walking distance and had a variety of poutines on its menu, so I strolled over. I sat at the (tiny) bar and was ignored by the staff until I asked for a menu and a beer. It wasn't busy. These kids just don't care! And, whatever, maybe it's their summer job to work in this poutine-slingery, but do your job right and attend to people who are ultimately paying your wages.I ordered poutine with mushrooms, onions and peppers. And was so disappointed. The dish came out SO FAST that there's no way the veggies were freshly prepared. The fries were already soggy, and the lack of cheese curds (seriously, there needed to be way more of those delicate little gems) made me an unhappy diner. And speaking of diner; what is this place? A soda stand? An indoor barn? It just emits a weird vibe and had a weird smell and overall, mehhhhhhh.The next day I had some poutine in the airport on my way home and it slayed this place. If you're looking for gut-busting fries, gravy and cheese, maybe try another spot.
Given a mini( petite ), but ordered and Paid for a late... food wasn't that good and bad service, waitress was rude, I wouldn't go back although it's close to my hotel room... I just won't eat...

I came with a rather large party on a Saturday night at 8:00 PM. We had 9 adults and 6 children -  not a very ideal group for the unfortunate waitstaff member who draws the short straw. We are also out-of-towners. 2 of us are from Southern California while everyone is are from various parts of Toronto. The kids started having meltdowns at 9:00 PM. One even started throwing up. Our waitress (whose name I unfortunately do not remember) was so gracious and helpful during such a trying time. If I could give more than 5 stars in a review, I would do so on her outstanding service and friendly, accommodating attitude alone. We did leave her a rather larger than normal tip, of course. Food was exceptional - my petit combo was tender and super flavorful. The matzo ball soup was absolutely delicious. I would definitely return.
We had Québécois poutine and a smoked meat bagel. Excellent food , great service and reasonable prices.

I loved this place,  had a very cozy friendly Montreal Canadian feel,  food and the staff were very good,  price is bit on the high side, but it is downtown Montreal like any oh her major city you can expect that.. Definitely a place to visit when visiting Montreal

first time in Montreal，smoked meat sandwich is so good and fresh, we switched fries with poutine and added onions and mushroom on top of the poutine. Poutine is just fires with cheese. Just tried it for the hype, not really my type but sandwich is good. Service is good too!
Very good poutine. Had the Dunn's famous with their smoked meat!! very tasty!!! staff are friendly and service is fast!

Checked out this place on the 13th, I had the chicken honey mustard salad without chicken lol but it was actually soooo good! The amount of "toppings" added to the salad was awesome - most restaurant just give mostly lettuce and it's disappointing.My fiancé had the bacon cheddar burger with mushrooms and smoked meat poutine. He liked it and said he would rate it 3.5. I would give a 4.So overall for tonight's visit we give 3.5-4.

Came here to try the Montreal-famous smoked meat and poutine. The meal I had had me wishing I went somewhere else. Also not terrible, I found the meat overly salty and a bit odd-looking. The poutine was okay, but I found the fries a bit too oily. The redeeming factor of the place is the service-our party of 7 was seated quickly and the waitress was very sweet and attentive!

This is the best Dunn's hands down in Montreal. I always order the Reubens sandwich and it never disappoint. What a classic joint that as been open for many years and it should stay open for many years to come !

We had to wait about 15 minutes for a table since we came during the heart of lunch hour. We sat at a table at the back of the restaurant. The server took awhile to get to our table. She served someone who was sat after us. We order a vegetable pizza and theclub roll with poutine (which is fries, cheese curds and gravy - a Montreal specialty) instead of French fries for an additional 4 dollars and a Molson beer. It was reasonable price. They accommodate my request for gravy on the side since my son does not eat meat and I wanted him to try the poutine. The small bathroom is located in the basement of the restaurant. I had to ask for the check are a while after our dishes were cleared.  The server did not come around to ask if everything was fine.

Dunns famous Caesar Bloody Mary type drink is awesome! They will put the game on if a match is in progress. Specialize in smoked meat and poutine. Not hard to go gluten free here if you are into meat. Cool atmosphere and decor. I enjoyed the smoked meat with fried rice, tomato, shallots. Potato skins with cheese and bacon are awesome.

My daughter and I were in town for a Dallas Stars game and wanted to try some poutine so we walked to Dunn's Famous as it was close to our hotel. Although they had quite a selection, we went with the traditional QUÉBÉCOISE. It was delicious. Next we shared the super combo smoked meat sandwich and which was moist, smokey, and served with the right amount of mustard. We had room for dessert so we chose the hot cookie and ice cream and we were glad we did. The cookie was thick, hot, and chocolatey with a healthy serving of ice cream and cool whip (in Stewie's voice) slowly melting on top. The staff was quick and attentive.Bonus: we were wearing our Stars gear and the wait staff talked hockey with us for quite a bit.
You can always count on Dunn's for late night big portioned smoked meat and poutine! We actually had to line up at 2 am for a seat haha! Great service and lovely crowd!
had dinner here with parents. they are not used to cheese. We ordered chichen wings, famous smoked meat and fish n chips. a lot of food and big plate. delicious and is our favorite food in Montreal!

Disclaimer: I love smoked meat. Hot, freshly carved smoked meat (not the cold thinly sliced kind that you find in supermarkets). I also love my smoked meat thickly cut and medium fatty. Lean meat does not go with smoked meat. (You're thinking turkey or chicken - if lean meat is what you want.)Ok, so being from Montreal my standards for smoked meat are high :)Now I know the "best" smoked meat in town is a topic of discussion (like our bagels lol) - but I'm Team Schwartz's! Yes, it's not the friendliest nor the fastest service - and there's always a line-up (unless you go really late at night, which I highly recommend btw, great vibe with the staff!). BUT they know how to make their smoked meat!!And when I'm either too far or too lazy to get to Schwartz's, my go-to place is Dunn's! Their smoked meat is satisfying - and has a nice fatty, marbling texture to it. Their fries are super crispy and good! And I enjoy their coleslaw and pickle too (and always get a Cott's Black Cherry soda). Again, like with Schwartz's - Dunn's isn't fancy. But they make a yummy smoked meat!

Should really be a 3.5 Star.  There around 10pm last night, place is pretty dear like the rest of the town on a Tuesday night.  Had their"famous poutine".   Nice portion... For $14++, it better be nice portion!!!What shall I say, taste like fries with gravy and smoke meat topping.  Nothing special, longing at it in a positive way, not bad.Worth the$14?  You pay for the central downtown eating.... Maybe you get a bit more vibe over the weekend.

Dunns used to be the place I would go when I first got to Montreal,  but that slowly changed over time as I discovered much better places for smoked meat around the city such as the Main.  Dunns has that interesting diner feel to it and it's located at the heart of the tourist area in Montreal. Usually the service is alright here, but there have been a handful of times I've gotten service that is beyond terrible.  I'm not talking they were slow or forgot to fill our drinks terrible.  I'm talking they slammed drinks on the table, dropped food on our laps and acted like we were bothering them when we would do a simple thing like ordering. On top of this the portions have gotten much smaller and the smoked meat just doesn't cut it compared to other places around town.  This definitely is not a place I frequent anymore and it's mainly due to the staff.

The brisket was delicious. I had mine on the bagel sandwich which was very good. My fiance had the   Beef burrito which was just OK. I would probably stick to the items they are known for.  The hand cut fries were definitely a plus. The place was very busy but the service was relatively quick. If you are in downtown Montreal this is definitely a staple to stop at.

So I had a mission to get a smoked meat sandwich while in Montreal. We were pretty beat, my wife's feet were hurting, so I got take out from this place.She got the chicken finger kids meal (cause she's kinda boring like that) and I got the small combo smoked meat sandwich. I didn't see what was so special about the smoked meat sandwich. It was tender but bland to me. Also, it had some gristle. To be fair, this is what I found with the other smoked meat sandwiches in Montreal. The fries were good and the cole slaw was delicious. I would have been interested to try other things here because the rest of the food looked good. The guy that took my order was pleasant and the service was good.They have their own cardboard box with their graphic design for take out, I like it for two reasons. One, it wasn't styrofoam, so it's better for the environment. Two, even though you're gonna toss it when you get home, you're bringing a piece of Dunn's with you with and to enjoy a little history about the place while you eat. I thought that was a nice touch.

Looking for your late night smoked meat fix downtown Montreal - look no further to Dunn on Metcalfe street.  They serve a hearty smoked meat sandwich and you can upgrade your fries to a mound of poutine of your choice.  What a filling meal!They also accept credit card which is a plus.  I would highly recommend this place if you are avoiding lineups at other smoked meat places. :)
I like Dunn's over Schwartz smoked meats but both are exceptionally good but Dunn's is 24/7 which makes it more convenient.

This was an excellent spot to stop after a hike up Mount Royal and a stroll around McGill! We had the québécois, which was delicious. We also had the matzah ball soup, and the Reuben with the latke. Highly recommend all of the above! I don't normally like Reubens but now I think I do. Our waiter was so friendly as well! Overall great experience.

I spent a lovely 8 days in Montreal, on a quest for superb Poutine. Dunn's was my favorite, very flavorsome gravy, chips cooked well and didn't go soggy quickly, cheese curds perfectly melted and infused throughout. Dunn's are famous for their smoked meats and Jewish deli classics which of course I also tried. Overall great food and one of my favorites in Montreal.

We loved this place so much we came here twice! I could not come to Montreal without trying their famous poutine and Wow was it good! We tried the regular poutine as well as the Dunn's Famous Poutine, both were amazing. We also loved their meat sandwiches and their potato soup.

Tons of food. Come here after a long day, if you just need good, greasy food and don't care about nutrition. Seriously good bang for the buck! The fatty cuts are really delicious. I would strongly going with any meat dish. The poutine was okay. Nothing too special but not bad. I suppose I'm not the best judge but I've had a number of poutine dishes in Montreal and this one ranked middling. The slaw was good!

When your girlfriend/boyfriend asks you what you're craving and you don't know, well just say smoked meat and bring them here and say that a yelper gave that advice!!!!! It shows in the name of the restaurant, "Dunn's FAMOUS" !!! Yes it is a known place for its smoked meat! And yes you should try it out! The atmosphere depicts the taste of smoked meat. The food is really good, the fries are just right, homemade ! The meat was not too dry. May be crowded at lunch time. The staff was almost emotionless, but the service was correct and adequate. But hey! I came here for the food! So you should too!

I love Dunns Famous...  I always have the Montreal smoked but other sandwiches are great too.  I'd stay away from the steak, its not their specialty.  Almost always packed either at 3pm or 3am.  I wish I could give a 4.5.  I will always visit when in Montreal.

I made an impromptu trip to Montreal and trusted yelp to guide me on my lunch choice. I did not know  that smoked meat was "a thing" in Montreal. I also did not know that Montreal smoked meat was so similar to pastrami, but I was sure happy to find Dunn's. See, I have an unhealthy obsession with the pastrami from Katz deli in New York. I often crave it when I'm far from NYC and have yet to find anything that comes close to filling its place. The smoked meat sandwich at Dunn's was also as good as Katz pastrami (which is a big compliment) and was incredibly satisfying. I got the small sandwich (which wasn't small at all) with fries and it was a perfect lunch. The service was fast and friendly and      they even let me charge my phone behind the bar.
I had the smoked meat poutine for lunch and it was good. A busy spot but service was quick for lunch. I enjoyed the meal and would recommend if looking for some smoke meat on saint Catherine street.

We came here for my husband's birthday.  We were lucky that we got a table because it was filling up fast.  My husband ordered the Dunn's Famous burger (which was a cheeseburger with their smoke meat on top) and I ordered the Double Combo 'D' (an appetizer plate with two potato skins, 4 smoked meat egg rolls and 4 cheese sticks).  The food was yummy.  My husband couldn't believe how delicious the smoked meat was on his burger!  My appetizer was a fun plate.  I was surprised that the meat egg rolls were shaped like raviolis.  Very tasty with all the condiments served with it.  I can say the burger was GOOD!  Their smoked meat was different and tasty.  YUM.
Wish we went to Schwsrtz instead. Smoked beef was ok and very poor wait staff (ours was horrible. The rest looked very attentive to their customers). Oh well...

Visiting Montreal, we were told to try the smoked meat dishes, so we grabbed some food to go on our way to the Tam Tam.The Reuben was perhaps the largest sandwich I've ever eaten, and they don't sacrifice flavor for size! Delicious. My wife loved her Downtown Wrap with its pickles and honey mustard sauce. The leftovers turned into an ample second meal later.$17 may seem steep for a sandwich, but it turned into two meals and I think was definitely worth it.

Just a real waste of precious calories in a city with so many better options.  The poutine may impress American tourists who have little experience with the dish, but there are so many better options - Frite Alors is nearby, and probably just as far to your hotel.Montreal's other foodie claim to fame is smoked meat, and here I'm less of an expert, but Dunn's just seems like flavorless pastrami to me.  If you have it as a sandwich it will come on thin unimpressive rye, just a bland disappointment.  So unauthentic that even the mustard is heinz.The experience comes packaged within a dank diner environment, with menus disintegrating from age.  All in all it is a real disappointment, certainly underserving of an overall 4-star on Yelp, and resting on laurels earned decades ago (when the menus were printed).

I arrived late into Downtown Montreal and luckily this place was open 24 hours on a Halloween night and right around the corner from our hotel! The place is a diner but the servers and waiters were all friendly. We ordered the smoked meat platter (1/2 pound of smoked meat!!) and the smoked meat spring rolls. The smoked meat was very fatty and juicy, perfect for a late night snack after being on a bus for 5 hours. It came with 4 slices of rye bread (not toasted), sauerkraut and 1/2 a dill pickle. Very filling and a large portion enough for 2. The spring rolls were so disappointing. This is why the review is 4 stars. Typical Chinese spring roll, with veggies (cabbage, carrot) with a little smoke meat with American-ized sweet and sour sauce on top. I ordered this instead of a poutine because of another Yelper's review and sounded intriguing (we are Asian). Could you imagine though, a spring roll stuffed with smoked meat and the thin crispy skin? Man. Could've been sooo much better. Anyways, I'd definitely come back since it's 24-hours, closer than Schwartz or the Main, and definitely will have to try the poutine. It seemed like everybody was getting the poutine and it came in a big red plastic bowl (so it must've been huge)!!

Went here because it was fairly close to the hotel we were staying at, was not disappointed in the service, nor the food, we both had the fish and chips and agreed it was one of the best pieces of fish we'd ever had! I would definitely recommend stopping by if you're ever in the area!

I dont know what the hype was all about. It was just average.  Service was slow and the food was greasy.  Cheap drinks were appreciated though!  I liked the smoked meat fried rice but everything else left much to be desired.
